Fetch Financial currencies Names

Source: R/get_currencies.R
get_currencies.Rd

This function fetches a table of financial indices (currencies) from Yahoo Finance. Optionally, it can filter the results to include only the specified indices.

Usage

get_currencies(keep = NULL)

Arguments

keep

A character vector of symbols to filter the results. If NULL (default), no filtering is applied, and all available indices are returned.

Value

A data frame containing unique financial indices (currencies). The table has columns like symbol, name, and other relevant information, with all column names in lowercase. If keep is specified, only the matching indices are returned.

Details

The function sends a request to Yahoo Finance's API to fetch a list of available currencies. It then processes the results and returns them as a data frame. If an internet connection is not available, a warning message is shown.

Examples

# Fetch all available indices
all_indices <- get_currencies()

# Fetch only specific indices
selected_indices <- get_currencies(keep = c("USD", "EUR"))
